16  package com.okta.sdk.impl.cache;
17  
18  import com.okta.sdk.cache.Cache;
19  import com.okta.sdk.impl.util.SoftHashMap;
20  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Assert;
21  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration;
22  import org.slf4j.Logger;
23  import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
24  
25  import java.util.Map;
26  import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
27  import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
28  
29  /**
30   * A <code>DefaultCache</code> is a {@link Cache Cache} implementation that uses a backing {@link Map} instance to store
31   * and retrieve cached data.
32   * <h2>Thread Safety</h2>
33   * This implementation is thread-safe <em>only</em> if the backing map is thread-safe.
34   *
35   * @since 0.5.0
36   */
37  public class DefaultCache<K, V> implements Cache<K, V> {
38  
39      private final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(DefaultCache.class);
40  
41      /**
42       * Backing map instance that stores the cache entries.
43       */
44      private final Map<K, Entry<V>> map;
45  
46      /**
47       * The amount of time allowed to pass since an entry was first created.  An entry older than this time,
48       * <b>regardless of how often it might be used</b>, will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
49       */
50      private volatile Duration timeToLive;
51  
52      /**
53       * The amount of time allowed to pass since an entry was last used (inserted or accessed).  An entry that has not
54       * been used in this amount of time will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
55       */
56      private volatile Duration timeToIdle;
57  
58      /**
59       * The name of this cache.
60       */
61      private final String name;
62  
63      private final AtomicLong accessCount;
64      private final AtomicLong hitCount;
65      private final AtomicLong missCount;
66  
67      /**
68       * Creates a new {@code DefaultCache} instance with the specified {@code name}, expected to be unique among all
69       * other caches in the parent {@code CacheManager}.
70       * <p>
71       * This constructor uses a {@link SoftHashMap} instance as the cache's backing map, which is thread-safe and
72       * auto-sizes itself based on the application's memory constraints.
73       * <p>
74       * Finally, the {@link #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToIdle} and
75       * {@link #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToLive} settings are both {@code null},
76       * indicating that cache entries will live indefinitely (except due to memory constraints as managed by the
77       * {@code SoftHashMap}).
78       *
79       * @param name the name to assign to this instance, expected to be unique among all other caches in the parent
80       *             {@code CacheManager}.
81       * @see SoftHashMap
82       * @see #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
83       * @see #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
84       */
85      public DefaultCache(String name) {
86          this(name, new SoftHashMap<K, Entry<V>>());
87      }
88  
89      /**
90       * Creates a new {@code DefaultCache} instance with the specified {@code name}, storing entries in the specified
91       * {@code backingMap}.  It is expected that the {@code backingMap} implementation be thread-safe and preferrably
92       * auto-sizing based on memory constraints (see {@link SoftHashMap} for such an implementation).
93       * <p>
94       * The {@link #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToIdle} and
95       * {@link #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) timeToLive} settings are both {@code null},
96       * indicating that cache entries will live indefinitely (except due to memory constraints as managed by the
97       * {@code backingMap} instance).
98       *
99       * @param name       name to assign to this instance, expected to be unique among all other caches in the parent
100      *                   {@code CacheManager}.
101      * @param backingMap the (ideally thread-safe) map instance to store the Cache entries.
102      * @see SoftHashMap
103      * @see #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
104      * @see #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
105      */
106     public DefaultCache(String name, Map<K, Entry<V>> backingMap) {
107         this(name, backingMap, null, null);
108     }
109 
110     /**
111      * Creates a new {@code DefaultCache} instance with the specified {@code name}, storing entries in the specified
112      * {@code backingMap}, using the specified {@code timeToLive} and {@code timeToIdle} settings.
113      * <p>
114      * It is expected that the {@code backingMap} implementation be thread-safe and preferrably
115      * auto-sizing based on memory constraints (see {@link SoftHashMap} for such an implementation).
116      *
117      * @param name       name to assign to this instance, expected to be unique among all other caches in the parent
118      *                   {@code CacheManager}.
119      * @param backingMap the (ideally thread-safe) map instance to store the Cache entries.
120      * @param timeToIdle the amount of time cache entries may remain idle until they should be removed from the cache.
121      * @param timeToLive the amount of time cache entries may exist until they should be removed from the cache.
122      * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either {@code timeToLive} or {@code timeToIdle} are non-null <em>and</em>
123      *                                  represent a non-positive (zero or negative) value. This is only enforced for
124      *                                  non-null values - {@code null} values are allowed for either argument.
125      * @see #setTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
126      * @see #setTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
127      */
128     public DefaultCache(String name, Map<K, Entry<V>> backingMap, Duration timeToLive, Duration timeToIdle) throws IllegalArgumentException {
129         Assert.notNull(name, "Cache name cannot be null.");
130         Assert.notNull(backingMap, "Backing map cannot be null.");
131         assertTtl(timeToLive);
132         assertTti(timeToIdle);
133         this.name = name;
134         this.map = backingMap;
135         this.timeToLive = timeToLive;
136         this.timeToIdle = timeToIdle;
137         this.accessCount = new AtomicLong(0);
138         this.hitCount = new AtomicLong(0);
139         this.missCount = new AtomicLong(0);
140     }
141 
142     protected static void assertTtl(Duration ttl) throws IllegalArgumentException {
143         if (ttl != null) {
144             Assert.isTrue(ttl.getValue() > 0, "timeToLive duration must be greater than zero");
145         }
146     }
147 
148     protected static void assertTti(Duration tti) throws IllegalArgumentException {
149         if (tti != null) {
150             Assert.isTrue(tti.getValue() > 0, "timeToIdle duration must be greater than zero");
151         }
152     }
153 
154     public V get(K key) {
155 
156         this.accessCount.incrementAndGet();
157 
158         Entry<V> entry = map.get(key);
159 
160         if (entry == null) {
161             missCount.incrementAndGet();
162             return null;
163         }
164 
165         long nowMillis = System.currentTimeMillis();
166 
167         Duration ttl = this.timeToLive;
168         Duration tti = this.timeToIdle;
169 
170         if (ttl != null) {
171             Duration sinceCreation = new Duration(nowMillis - entry.getCreationTimeMillis(), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
172             if (sinceCreation.isGreaterThan(ttl)) {
173                 map.remove(key);
174                 missCount.incrementAndGet(); //count an expired TTL as a miss
175                 logger.trace("Removing {} from cache due to TTL, sinceCreation: {}", key, sinceCreation);
176                 return null;
177             }
178         }
179 
180         if (tti != null) {
181             Duration sinceLastAccess = new Duration(nowMillis - entry.getLastAccessTimeMillis(), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
182             if (sinceLastAccess.isGreaterThan(tti)) {
183                 map.remove(key);
184                 missCount.incrementAndGet(); //count an expired TTI as a miss
185                 logger.trace("Removing {} from cache due to TTI, sinceLastAccess: {}", key, sinceLastAccess);
186                 return null;
187             }
188         }
189 
190         entry.lastAccessTimeMillis = nowMillis;
191 
192         hitCount.incrementAndGet();
193 
194         return entry.getValue();
195     }
196 
197     public V put(K key, V value) {
198         Entry<V> newEntry = new Entry<V>(value);
199         Entry<V> previous = map.put(key, newEntry);
200         if (previous != null) {
201             return previous.value;
202         }
203         return null;
204     }
205 
206     @Override
207     public V remove(K key) {
208         accessCount.incrementAndGet();
209         Entry<V> previous = map.remove(key);
210         if (previous != null) {
211             hitCount.incrementAndGet();
212             return previous.value;
213         } else {
214             missCount.incrementAndGet();
215             return null;
216         }
217     }
218 
219     /**
220      * Returns the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
221      * longer be available.  If a cache entry ever becomes older than this amount of time (regardless of how often
222      * it is accessed), it will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
223      *
224      * @return the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
225      *         longer be available.
226      */
227     public Duration getTimeToLive() {
228         return timeToLive;
229     }
230 
231     /**
232      * Sets the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
233      * longer be available.  If a cache entry ever becomes older than this amount of time (regardless of how often
234      * it is accessed), it will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
235      *
236      * @param timeToLive the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and
237      *                   no longer be available.
238      */
239     public void setTimeToLive(Duration timeToLive) {
240         assertTtl(timeToLive);
241         this.timeToLive = timeToLive;
242     }
243 
244     /**
245      * Returns the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
246      * no longer be available.  If a cache entry is not accessed at all after this amount of time, it will be
247      * removed from the cache as soon as possible.
248      *
249      * @return the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
250      *         no longer be available.
251      */
252     public Duration getTimeToIdle() {
253         return timeToIdle;
254     }
255 
256     /**
257      * Sets the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
258      * no longer be available.  If a cache entry is not accessed at all after this amount of time, it will be
259      * removed from the cache as soon as possible.
260      *
261      * @param timeToIdle the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire
262      *                   and no longer be available.
263      */
264     public void setTimeToIdle(Duration timeToIdle) {
265         assertTti(timeToIdle);
266         this.timeToIdle = timeToIdle;
267     }
268 
269     /**
270      * Returns the number of attempts to return a cache entry.  Note that because {@link #remove(Object)} will return
271      * a value, calls to both {@link #get(Object)} and {@link #remove(Object)} will increment this number.
272      *
273      * @return the number of attempts to return a cache entry
274      * @see #getHitCount()
275      * @see #getMissCount()
276      * @see #getHitRatio()
277      */
278     public long getAccessCount() {
279         return this.accessCount.get();
280     }
281 
282     /**
283      * Returns the total number of times an access attempt successfully returned a cache entry.
284      *
285      * @return the total number of times an access attempt successfully returned a cache entry.
286      * @see #getMissCount()
287      * @see #getHitRatio()
288      */
289     public long getHitCount() {
290         return hitCount.get();
291     }
292 
293     /**
294      * Returns the total number of times an access attempt did not return a cache entry.
295      *
296      * @return the total number of times an access attempt successfully returned a cache entry.
297      * @see #getHitCount()
298      * @see #getHitRatio()
299      */
300     public long getMissCount() {
301         return missCount.get();
302     }
303 
304     /**
305      * Returns the ratio of {@link #getHitCount() hitCount} to {@link #getAccessCount() accessCount}.  The closer this
306      * number is to {@code 1.0}, the more effectively the cache is being used.  The closer this number is to
307      * {code 0.0}, the less effectively the cache is being used.
308      *
309      * @return the ratio of {@link #getHitCount() hitCount} to {@link #getAccessCount() accessCount}.
310      */
311     public double getHitRatio() {
312         double accessCount = (double) getAccessCount();
313         if (accessCount > 0) {
314             double hitCount = (double) getHitCount();
315 
316             return hitCount / accessCount;
317         }
318         return 0;
319     }
320 
321     /**
322      * Removes all entries from this cache.
323      */
324     public void clear() {
325         map.clear();
326     }
327 
328     /**
329      * Returns the total number of cache entries currently available in this cache.
330      *
331      * @return the total number of cache entries currently available in this cache.
332      */
333     public int size() {
334         return map.size();
335     }
336 
337     /**
338      * Returns this cache instance's name.
339      *
340      * @return this cache instance's name.
341      */
342     public String getName() {
343         return this.name;
344     }
345 
346     public String toString() {
347         return new StringBuilder("    {\n      \"name\": \"").append(name).append("\",\n")
348                 .append("      \"size\": ").append(map.size()).append(",\n")
349                 .append("      \"accessCount\": ").append(getAccessCount()).append(",\n")
350                 .append("      \"hitCount\": ").append(getHitCount()).append(",\n")
351                 .append("      \"missCount\": ").append(getMissCount()).append(",\n")
352                 .append("      \"hitRatio\": ").append(getHitRatio()).append("\n")
353                 .append("    }")
354                 .toString();
355     }
356 
357     /**
358      * An Entry is a wrapper that encapsulates the actual {@code value} stored in the cache as well as
359      * {@link #getCreationTimeMillis() creationTimeMillis} and {@link #getLastAccessTimeMillis() lastAccessTimeMillis}
360      * metadata about the entry itself.  The {@code creationTimeMillis} and {@code lastAccessTimeMillis} values are used
361      * to support expunging cache entries based on
362      * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} and
363      * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} settings, respectively.
364      *
365      * @param <V> the type of value that is stored in the cache.
366      */
367     public static class Entry<V> {
368 
369         private final V value;
370         private final long creationTimeMillis;
371         private volatile long lastAccessTimeMillis;
372 
373         /**
374          * Creates a new Entry instance wrapping the specified {@code value}, defaulting both the
375          * {@link #getCreationTimeMillis() creationTimeMillis} and the {@link #getLastAccessTimeMillis() lastAccessTimeMills}
376          * to the current timestamp (i.e. {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}).
377          *
378          * @param value the cache entry to store.
379          */
380         public Entry(V value) {
381             this.value = value;
382             this.creationTimeMillis = System.currentTimeMillis();
383             this.lastAccessTimeMillis = this.creationTimeMillis;
384         }
385 
386         /**
387          * Returns the actual value stored in the cache.
388          *
389          * @return the actual value stored in the cache.
390          */
391         public V getValue() {
392             return value;
393         }
394 
395         /**
396          * Returns the creation time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was created.  This is used to
397          * support expunging cache entries when this value is older than the cache's
398          * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} setting.
399          *
400          * @return the creation time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was created.
401          */
402         public long getCreationTimeMillis() {
403             return creationTimeMillis;
404         }
405 
406         /**
407          * Returns the time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was last accessed.  This is used to
408          * support expunging cache entries when this value is older than the cache's
409          * {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} setting.
410          *
411          * @return the time in millis since Epoch when this {@code Entry} instance was last accessed.
412          */
413         public long getLastAccessTimeMillis() {
414             return lastAccessTimeMillis;
415         }
416     }
417 }
